title: Drawing, "Design for an Altar Mensa, Possibly for Santa  Maria del Priorato", 1764–66
medium: Pen and dark brown ink; graphite on off white laid paper
markings: Verso: stamp of the Cooper Union Museum [Lugt 457e]
inscribed: In black ink, upper right corner: 116
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Drawing of a centraly projecting altar mensa with two alternative suggestions for the lateral pillars. The right one applies a baluster form. The sarcophagus is angular. In the central panel is the monogram of Christ; crossed palm branches are on the cover. Two lions heads are connected by a festoon. In the panels of the lateral parts are escutcheons displaying a prelate's coat of arms with an eagle.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for an Altar Mensa, Possibly for Santa  Maria del Priorato", 1764–66.
1764–66. Pen and dark brown ink; graphite on off white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4193.
